Research Experience.name: University of Washington, Seattle
Research Experience.summary:
Metallicity study of the ionized diffuse gas at the Milky Way disk-halo interface using HST UV archival data 
      with a precise ionization correction. This work traces the Galactic fountain mechanism and gas mixing in the Milky Way CGM.

Research Experience.name: University of Washington, Seattle
Research Experience.summary: Chemical abundance study of evolved massive stars to search for Thorne-{\.Z}ytkow objects

Research Experience.name: UNIST | Ulsan National Institute of Science and Technology
Research Experience.advisor: Prof. Maurice H. P. M. van Putten
Research Experience.summary: 3-body simulation to investigate orbital stability of prograding and retrograding circumbinary planets

Research Experience.name: Sejong University
summary: Spectroscopic survey of Raman-scattered He~II features in young planetary nebulae.
Radiative transfer for Raman-scattered He~II in a thick H~I medium of mass-losing evolved stars.
highlights: Planetary nebula, Evolved star, Radiative transfer, Spectroscopy, Raman scattering

publications.name: The Metallicity Mapping of the Ionized Diffuse Gas at the Milky Way Disk-halo Interface
publications.author: Choi, B.-E., Werk, J. K., Tchernyshyov, K., et al.

publications.name: Discovery of Raman-scattered He II λ6545 in the Planetary Nebulae NGC 6886 and NGC 6881
publications.author: Choi, B.-E. & Lee, H.-W.

publications.name: Line Formation of Raman-scattered He II λ 4851 in an Expanding Spherical H I Shell in Young Planetary Nebulae
publications.author: Choi, B.-E., Chang, S.-J., Lee, H.-G. & Lee, H.-W.

publications.name: RAMSES II: RAMan Search for Extragalactic Symbiotic Stars Project Concept, Commissioning, and Early Results from the Science Verification Phase

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
